H4161.def: = action by which humans, deities, plants, or objects leave or emerge from a certain place or position

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H2212.def: = process by which some element is purged of less pure elements

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H5154.def: = a yellowish-brown alloy of copper with up to one-third tin, ≈ regarded as a hard and difficult to bend

H6694.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to experience distress, either with words or with actions, ► usually with the purpose of forcing that person to make certain concessions

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H652.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

H6757.def: literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H1809.def: = process by which the height of a body of water is diminished ◄ due to a drought

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H5601.def: = (semi-)precious stone with a deep blue color, possibly sapphire

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H5861.def: = class of larger birds of prey; ≈ associated with aggression and death

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H344.def: = bird of prey of a relatively small size, that can fly fast, but also hover; lives on rats, mice, and other birds; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H7805.def: = process by which humans and animals focus their eyes on an object

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H7826.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2496.def: = hard stone; ◄ consisting of nearly pure silica; ≈ symbol of a strong will-power

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

10.gl: to lay (one's) hands (on someone or something)

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3366.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H370.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5458.def: literally: the covering of the heart; hence, probably: = the bony frame formed by the ribs, which covers the heart

H4242.def: = the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something

H8254.def: = action by which humans determine the weight of an object, which is usually done with the help of a balance (scales)

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H211.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Joktan<SDBH:יָקְטָן>}; descendant of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a people living in a region with the same name

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H7718.def: = (semi-)precious stone with straight layers of a white color, alternating with black, brown, or red; ◄ possibly variety of chalcedony: onyx

H5601.def: = (semi-)precious stone with a deep blue color, possibly sapphire

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H2137.def: = a hard, more or less transparent substance ◄ produced by fusing sand with soda and lime; ≈ considered of high value

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H6337.def: = {L:gold<SDBH:זָהָב>} refined to a high level of purity; ≈ considered rare, beautiful and very valuable

H7215.def: = hard stony substance secreted by certain colonial marine animals as an external skeleton, typically forming large reefs; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H1378.def: = a solidified rock, typically covered by many smooth faces, which often have geometrical shapes, ≈ appreciated for value and beauty

H4901.def: = a flexible container with an opening at the top, ◄ probably made out of leather

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6443.def: = a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H6357.def: = (semi-)precious stone of a golden yellow color, possibly topaz or chrysolite

H3568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as ancestor of the {L:Cushites<SDBH:כּוּשִׁי>}

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H370.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H11.def: = abode of the dead; ≈ seen as a place extremely remote from the activities of everyday life but still accessible to God

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4948.def: = a measure of the heaviness of an object

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H8505.def: = action by which humans or deities determine the weight or size of an object

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2385.def: = type of cumulus cloud that accompanies rainstorms; ≈ often associated with God's glory

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
